                                                                    Section A

     Question                                         Answers                                   Notes                        Total
1.     a
                «
                     (renewables  hydroelectricity  nuclear) »
                                       total
                                                                                                                               1
                  8800  7200 
                «               100 » 13 «%»                               Accept range of “11–16 %”.
                  12600 
1.     b        «18000  0.54x  2000»
                x  37037 «million tonnes of CO2»                              Accept “37000 «million tonnes of CO2»”
                                                                                for M1.
                    32.00
                «            37037  26930»
                    44.01                                                                                                      2
                                                                                Award [2] for correct final answer with
                27000/2.7 x 104 «million tonnes of O2»                         two significant figures.
                                                                                Award [1] for non rounded answers in
                                                                                range 26903–26936 «million tonnes of
                                                                                O2».
1.     c    i   increase in «atmospheric» pressure                              Accept “increase in volume of oceans
                OR                                                              «due to polar ice cap melting»” OR
                                                                                “consumption of O2 in oceans/O2 (aq)
                increase in [O2 (g)]/concentration of O2 (g)                    «by living organisms»”.
                OR                                                                                                             1
                decrease in [O2 (aq)]/concentration of O2 (aq)                  State symbols required for oxygen
                                                                                concentration.
                OR
                decrease in temperature 

(Question 1c continued)

      Question                                             Answers                                                  Notes                     Total
 1.     c    ii    summer in one station while winter in other                                     Accept “opposite seasons «in each
                   OR                                                                              hemisphere»”.

                   stations are at different latitudes                                            Do not accept “different locations with
                                                                                                   different temperatures” OR “stations are    2
                                                                                                   in different hemispheres”.


                   oxygen dissolves better in colder water 
 1.     c    iii        209400                                                                     The nitrogen cancels so is not needed
                   «(             1 ) 106 » − 286.5 «per meg»                                 in the calculation.
                        209460                                                                                                                 1
                                                                                                   Negative sign required for mark.
 1.     c    iv    decrease in [O2]/concentration of O2                                            Accept “decrease in level of O2”.
                   OR                                                                              Accept “increasing CO2 production
                   increasing combustion of fossil fuels «consumes more O2 so [O2]/concentration   «consumes more O2 so
                   of O2 decreases»                                                                [O2]/concentration of O2 decreases»”.
                                                                                                                                               1
                   OR
                                                                                                   Do not accept “decrease in amount of
                   warmer oceans/seas/water «as oxygen dissolves better in colder water»           O2” OR “increase in greenhouse gases”.
                   OR
                   deforestation 
                                                                      –5–                                       M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                      Answers                                                      Notes                          Total
2.   a        mass/m of lighter before AND after the experiment                             Accept “change in mass of lighter”.
              volume of gas/Vgas «collected in the cylinder»                                Accept “weight” for “mass”.
                                                                                             Accept “volume of water displaced”.
              «ambient» pressure/P «of the room»                                                                                              4
                                                                                             Do not accept just “mass of lighter/gas”.
              temperature/T                                                                 Do not accept “amount” for “volume” or
                                                                                             “mass”.
2.   b    i   Any two of:                                                                    Accept “vapour pressure of water not
              pressure of gas not equalized with atmospheric/room pressure                  accounted for” OR “incorrect vapour
                                                                                             pressure of water used” OR “air bubbles
              too large a recorded volume «of gas produces a lower value for molar mass of   trapped in cylinder”. Do not accept
              butane»                                                                        “gas/bubbles escaping «the cylinder»”
              OR                                                                             or other results leading to a larger molar
                                                                                             mass.
              cylinder tilted 

                                                                                             Accept “lighter might contain mixture of
              difficult to dry lighter «after experiment»                                    propane and butane”.                            2 max
              OR
              higher mass of lighter due to moisture
              OR                                                                             Do not accept only “human errors” OR
              smaller change in mass but same volume «produces lower value for molar mass    “faulty equipment” (without a clear
              of butane»                                                                   explanation given for each) or “mistakes
                                                                                             in calculations”.

              using degrees Celcius/oC instead of Kelvin/K for temperature 

                                                                            –6–                                   M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

(Question 2b continued)

    Question                                        Answers                                                     Notes                     Total
 2.   b    ii    record vapour pressure of water «at that temperature»
                 OR
                 equalize pressure of gas in cylinder with atmospheric/room pressure            Accept “adjust cylinder «up or down» to
                 OR                                                                             ensure water level inside cylinder
                                                                                                matches level outside”.
                 tap cylinder before experiment «to dislodge trapped air»
                 OR
                                                                                                Accept “repeat experiment/readings «to
                 collect gas using a «gas» syringe/eudiometer/narrower/more precise graduated   eliminate random errors»”.
                 tube
                 OR                                                                                                                        1
                 collect gas through tubing «so lighter does not get wet»
                 OR
                 dry lighter «before and after experiment»
                 OR
                                                                                                Accept “use pure butane gas”.
                 hold «measuring» cylinder vertical
                 OR
                 commence experiment with cylinder filled with water 

                                                                       Section B
Option A — Materials

   Question                                         Answers                                                    Notes                        Total
3.   a           reinforcing «phase» 
                                                                                                                                             2
                 «embedded in» matrix «phase» 
3.    b                                                                                      Award [2] for all 4, [1] for 2 or 3 correct.
                                         Physical or chemical   Bottom up or top down
                  Lithography            physical               top down                                                                     2

                  Metal coordination     chemical               bottom up               

3.    c    i     100%                                                                       Accept “almost 100%” if a catalyst is
                                                                                             referred to.                                    1

3.    c    ii    addition AND no atoms removed/all atoms accounted for/no loss of
                 water/ammonia/inorganic by-product/small molecules
                 OR                                                                                                                          1
                 addition AND there is only one «reaction» product 
3.    c    iii   amido                                                                       Accept “amide/carboxamide/carbamoyl”
                 OR                                                                          for “amido”.
                                                                                                                                             1
                 amino                                                                      Accept “amine“ for “amino”.
                                                                                             Accept “carbonyl”.
                                                                       –8–                                          M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                 Total
4.   a        HCl/hydrogen chloride                                                              Accept “hydrochloric acid”.             1
4.   b        forms four/six/several/multiple coordinate/coordination bonds «to a central metal   Accept “dative «covalent»” for
              ion»                                                                                “coordinate/coordination”.
              OR
              is a polydentate/tetradentate/hexadentate ligand                                   Do not accept just “chelates”.


              forms more stable complex/stronger bonds with central metal ion
              OR
              increases entropy/S by releasing smaller «monodentate ligand» molecules                                                     3
              previously complexed 


              complex ions are much larger «and can be removed easily due to large size of
              chelate complexes»
              OR
              heavy metal ions trapped inside the ligand/become «biologically» inactive/non-
              toxic/harmless 
                                                                      –9–                           M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                   Answers                                             Notes                 Total
5.   a        carbon monoxide/CO adsorbs onto palladium/Pd 


              bonds stretched/weakened/broken
              OR
              «new» bonds formed                                                                                          3
              OR
              activation energy/Ea «barrier» lowered «in both forward and reverse
              reactions» 
              products/CO2 desorb «from surface of catalyst» 
5.   b    i   Fe/iron                                                               Accept “Mn/manganese”.
              OR
              Zn/zinc
              OR
              Co/cobalt                                                                                                   1
              OR
              Cd/cadmium
              OR
              Cr/chromium 

(Question 5b continued)

    Question                                               Answers                               Notes                     Total
 5.   b    ii     Ni2 (aq)   + Fe (s)   Ni (s) +   Fe2 (aq)                 Accept “3Ni2 (aq)    2Cr (s)  3Ni (s) 
                  OR                                                          2Cr3 (aq)”.
                                                                              Do not penalize similar equations
                  Ni2 (aq) + Zn (s)     Ni (s) + Zn2 (aq)
                                                                              involving formation of Fe3(aq),
                  OR                                                          Mn2 (aq) OR Co3 (aq).
                  Ni2 (aq) + Co (s)  Ni (s) + Co2 (aq)                    Ignore Cl− ions.
                                                                                                                            1
                  OR                                                          Accept correctly balanced non-ionic
                  Ni2 (aq) + Cd (s)  Ni (s) + Cd2 (aq)                     equations eg, “NiCl2 (aq)  Zn (s) 
                  OR                                                          Ni (s)  ZnCl2 (aq)” etc.
                  Ni2 (aq) + Cr (s)  Ni (s) + Cr2 (aq) 
                                                                              Do not allow ECF from (b) (i).
 5.   b     iii   Ksp  [Ni2][OH−]2
                  OR
                                                                                                                            2
                  5.48  10−16  [Ni2][10−3.5]2 
                                                                              Award [2] for correct final answer.
                  «[Ni2] » 5.48  10−9 «mol dm−3» 
                                                                          – 11 –                         M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                      Answers                                                Notes                       Total
5.   c    i    paramagnetic materials have unpaired electrons                          Accept “diamagnetic materials have no
                                                                                       unpaired electrons" for M1.
               OR
               diamagnetic materials have all electrons «spin-»paired 
                                                                                                                                      2
               unpaired electrons align with an external magnetic field
               OR
               paired electrons are not influenced by magnetic field 
5.   c    ii                                                                           Conductor:
                                                                                       Accept any concave upwards curve or
                                                                                       line showing resistance increasing with
                                                                                       temperature. There should be a y-axis
                                                                                       intercept. Do not accept x-axis
                                                                                       intercept for conductor.

                                                                                                                                      2
                                                                                       Superconductor:
                                                                                       Sharp transition with vertical line to
                                                                                       x-axis. Greater than Tc, accept any
                                                                                       concave upwards curve or line showing
                                                                                       resistance increasing with temperature.
                                                                                  




                                                                                                                                 (continued…)
                                                                           – 12 –                                         M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

(Question 5c continued)

    Question                                         Answers                                                         Notes                     Total
 5.   c    iii   Any three of:                                                                      Award [1 max] if three correct pieces of
                 type 1 have lower critical temperature/Tc «than type 2»                            information are given for one type only
                                                                                                    without contrasting with the other type.
                 OR
                 type 2 can superconduct at higher temperatures «than type 1» 
                                                                                                    Marks may also be awarded from
                 type 1 are «elemental» metals AND type 2 can be alloys/composites/metal oxide      suitable sketch(es).
                 ceramics/perovskites 
                 type 1 have sharp transition to superconductivity AND type 2 have more gradual
                 transition 
                                                                                                                                               3 max
                 type 1 have all «magnetic» flux expelled to normal state AND type 2 have partial
                 penetration of flux in mixed state 
                 type 1 typically work via Cooper pairs AND type 2 may not necessarily use this
                 mechanism 
                 magnetic fields can penetrate type 2 in the mixed state «in a type of Vortex»
                 AND type 1 has no mixed state 
                 type 1 have one critical magnetic field/Bc AND type 2 have two/Bc and Bc 
                                                                                    1      2

                                                                                                    Accept “H” for “B”.
                                                                       – 13 –                                      M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                 Total
6.   a        Polar molecule:
              «orientation of molecule» influenced by electric field/«applied» voltage/«applied»
              potential «difference»/«applied» current
              OR
              can be switched on and off 


              Long alkyl chain:                                                                                                          2
                                                                                                   Accept “makes molecule rod-shaped”
              prevents close packing of molecules                                                  for M2.
              OR
              molecules can align
              OR
              reduces the melting point of the liquid crystal/LC «phase making liquid at room
              temperature» 
                                                                         – 14 –    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


   Question                                           Answers                     Notes                Total
6.   b        inability to replicate calibrations below certain levels
              OR
              variation in methodology
              OR
              variation between machines calibrated with the same samples
              OR
              variation in plasma torches
              OR                                                                                         1
              different detection limits for MS and OES
              OR
              interference from solvents/other chemicals
              OR
              inability to produce pure standards
              OR
              chance that low signal and blank are the same 

7.              HDPE AND LDPE «have similar IR»                 Accept “water bottle AND water bottle
                                                                 cap” for M1.

                both are polyethene/polyethylene
                OR
                only branching differs                                                                    2
                OR
                same bonds
                OR
                same bending/stretching/vibrations 

Option B — Biochemistry

   Question                                        Answers                                                Notes                      Total
8.   a                                                                                  Accept CO-NH but not CO-HN for
                                                                                        amide link.


                                                                                        Accept a full or condensed structural
                                                                                        formula.                                      2
               correct order 
               amide link                                                              Penalize incorrect bond linkages or
                                                                                        missing hydrogens once only in 8 (a)
                                                                                        and 8 (c) (i).
8.   b                                                                                  Do not penalize if lines are omitted or if
                                                                                        different markings are given (eg, spots
                                                                                        etc.), as long as relative positions are
                                                                                        correctly indicated.
                                                                                                                                      2
               Cys and Gln move to positive electrode AND Lys to negative electrode    Accept Gln on original position
                                                                                        indicated.
               Cys further to positive electrode than Gln 
                                                                                        Award [1 max] for reverse order of
                                                                                        amino acids.
                                                         – 17 –                    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

   Question                                    Answers                             Notes                 Total
8.   c    i                                                       Penalize incorrect bond linkages or
                                                                  missing hydrogens once only in 8 (a)
                                                                  and 8 (c) (i).
                                      

                                                                                                          1




8.   c    ii                       0.500                        pH can be deduced by an alternative
               «pH  9.87 + log          »                      method.
                                   0.700 
                                                                                                          1
               « 9.87 – 0.146»
                9.72 
                                                                      – 18 –                                    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

   Question                                      Answers                                                       Notes                     Total
9.   a        stearic acid AND chain has no kinks/more regular structure
              OR
              stearic acid AND it has straight chain
              OR
              stearic acid AND no CC/carbon to carbon double bonds
              OR
              stearic acid AND saturated                                                      Accept “stearic acid AND greater
                                                                                              surface area/electron density”.             2
              OR
              stearic acid AND chains pack more closely together 
                                                                                              M2 can only be scored if stearic acid is
              stronger London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces   correctly identified.
              «between molecules» 
                                                                                              Accept “stronger intermolecular/van der
                                                                                              Waals’/vdW forces”.


9.   b        «n(I2) = 0.123 dm3  0.500 mol dm–3 » 0.0615 «mol»                            Award [3] for correct final answer.
              «m(I2)  0.0615 mol  253.8 g mol–1 » 15.6 «g»                                Iodine number must be a whole number.
                                 15.6 g  100                                                                                             3
              «iodine number                   »= 156                                       Award [2 max] for 78.
                                   10.0 g
                                               – 19 –                     M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

  Question                           Answers                           Notes                    Total
10. a        C17H31COONa                              Accept “NaC17H31COO”.


             [(CH3)3NCH2CH2OH]OH                       Accept “(CH3)3NCH2CH2OH” OR
                                                        “[(CH3)3NCH2CH2OH]” if positive
                                                        charge is shown.                         2
                                                        Accept suitable names (eg, sodium
                                                        linoleate, choline hydroxide etc.) OR
                                                        correct molecular formulas.

10.   b      hydrolysis                                Accept “nucleophilic
                                                        substitution/displacement / SN/SN2 /
                                                        saponification”.                         1
                                                        Do not accept “acid hydrolysis”.

11. a        Only in straight chain form:
             carbonyl                                                  Accept functional group abbreviations
                                                                       (eg, CHO etc.).
             OR
             aldehyde                                                                                             2


             Only in ring structure:
             hemiacetal                                               Accept “ether”.

11.   b                                                                Correct 1,4 beta link AND all bonds on
                                                                       the 2 carbons in the link required for
                                                                       mark.


                                                                       Ignore any errors in the rest of the
                                                                       structure.


                                                                       Penalize extra atoms on carbons in link.    1




             correct link between the two monosaccharides 

  Question                                     Answers                          Notes                Total
11. c        minimize «negative» impact on environment
             OR
             minimize waste produced
             OR
             consider atom economy
             OR
             efficiency of synthetic process
             OR
             problems of side reactions/lower yields                                                   1
             OR
             control temperature «inside large reactors»
             OR
             availability of starting/raw materials
             OR
             minimize energy costs
             OR
             value for money/cost effectiveness/cost of production 

             carbon» bonds
             OR                                                                                                                      1
             delocalized electrons «over much of the molecule» ü                             Accept “delocalization”.
12.   b      cis«-retinal» converts to trans«-retinal»
             OR
                                                                                                                                     1
             one of the CC «fragments in retinal» changes «its configuration» from cis to
             trans 

  Question                                       Answers                                                      Notes                     Total
13. a                               1                                                        Accept answers in the range of
             «Km  [substrate] at       Vmax»
                                    2                                                        3.5 103 to 5.0 103 mol dm3.
             4.2  10–3                                                                     M2 can be scored independently.
                                                                                                                                         2
             mol dm3 



13.   b                                                                                      Do not penalize if curve does not finish
                                                                                             exactly at same Vmax as long as it is
                                                                                             close to it (since drawn curve does not
                                                                                             flatten out completely at Vmax  0.50).



                                                                                                                                         1




             graph to right of curve AND finish at same Vmax 
13.   c      Km is inverse measure of affinity of enzyme for a substrate / Km is inversely   Idea of inverse relationship must be
             proportional to enzyme activity                                                 conveyed.
             OR
             high value of Km indicates higher substrate concentration needed for enzyme     Accept “high value of Km indicates low
             saturation                                                                      affinity of enzyme for substrate/less
                                                                                                                                         1
             OR                                                                              stable ES complex/lower enzyme
                                                                                             activity”.
             low value of Km means reaction is fast at low substrate concentration 
                                                                                             Accept “low value of Km indicates high
                                                                                             affinity of enzyme for substrate/stable
                                                                                             ES complex/greater enzyme activity”.

  Question                                         Answers                                                  Notes                     Total
14. a        oxygen binds to first active site «of deoxygenated heme» AND alters shape of
             other active sites
             OR
                                                                                                                                       2
             cooperative binding 
             affinity of partially oxygenated hemoglobin for oxygen increases 
14.   b      CO is a competitive inhibitor «of oxygen binding to hemoglobin»                Do not penalize “CO binds irreversibly”
                                                                                            if included in answer.
             OR
             CO has greater affinity for hemoglobin «than oxygen» 


             less oxygen is transported                                                                                                2
             OR
             uptake of oxygen decreases
             OR
             causes hypoxia 



15.   a      phosphate groups «in nucleotides fragments are almost completely» ionized     Do not accept just “phosphate
                                                                                            «groups»”.                                 1

Option C — Energy

  Question                                         Answers                                         Notes                  Total
16. a    i      2
                 H  31H  42 He  01n                                        Accept “n” for “ 10 n ”.
                1
                                                                                                                           1
                                                                               Accept “2H  3H  4He  1n/n”.
16.   a   ii    higher binding energy/BE «per nucleon» for helium/products     Accept converse statement in M1.
                OR
                                                                                                                           2
                nucleons in products more tightly bound 
                mass defect/lost matter converted to energy                   Accept “mass deficit” for “mass defect”.
16.   a   iii   ΔBE  BE(4He) − (BE(2H) + BE(3H))                              Accept answers in range 17.3 to 18.1
                                                                               «MeV».
                OR
                                                                               Award [1 max] for final answers in          2
                ΔBE  4  7.1 − (2  1.1 + 3  2.8)                           range of 3.0 to 3.4 «MeV».
                 17.8 «MeV»                                                  Award [2] for correct final answer.
16.   b         spectrometry                                                  Accept “spectroscopy” for
                                                                               “spectrometry” OR more specific
                                                                               techniques such as “atomic absorption
                                                                               spectrometry/AAS”, “astrophotometry”
                                                                                                                           1
                                                                               etc. Do not award mark for incorrect
                                                                               specific spectrometric techniques.
                                                                               Do not accept “spectrum”.
                                                                      – 26 –                                    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

  Question                                         Answers                                                      Notes                    Total
17. a        Energy           Advantage                           Disadvantage                 Do not award marks for converse
             source                                                                            statements for advantage and
                                                                                               disadvantage.
             Biofuels   low carbon footprint        lower energy content/specific energy
                                                                                               Points related to greenhouse gases
                        OR                          OR
                                                                                               should be counted only once for the
                        sustainable/renewable       high cost (only if a specific example if   entire question.
                        OR                          given eg, growing corn for ethanol etc.)
                        lower emissions of CO       OR
                                                                                               Biofuels:
                        «for biodiesel/ethanol».    use agricultural
                                                                                               Accept “«close to» carbon neutral”,
                        OR                          resources/fertilizers/pesticides/water
                                                                                               “produce less greenhouse gases/CO2”
                        economic                    OR                                         as an advantage.
                        security/availability in    biodiesel has high viscosity/clogs fuel
                        countries without crude     injectors
                        oil                        OR
                                                                                               Accept “engines have to be modified if     4
                                                    less suitable in low temperatures          biodiesel used” as a disadvantage.
                                                    OR
                                                    increased NOx emissions for biodiesel
                                                    OR
                                                    greenhouse gases/CO2 «still/also»
                                                    produced 
             Fossil     higher energy               linked to climate change/global
                                                                                               Fossil Fuels:
             fuels      content/specific energy     warming/increased release of
                                                    greenhouse gases                           Accept specific pollution examples (eg,
                        OR
                                                                                               oil spills, toxic substances released
                        low cost                    OR
                                                                                               when burning crude oil, etc.) as a
                        OR                          not sustainable/renewable                  disadvantage.
                        readily accessible         OR
                                                    greater pollution possibilities 
                                                                          – 27 –                               M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

  Question                                          Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
17. b    i     «specific energy » 142                                                      Accept other correct values with the
                                                                                             correct corresponding units.
               kJ g–1 
                                                                                             M2 can be scored independently.            2


17.   b   ii   large volumes of hydrogen required
               OR
               hydrogen has lower energy density 


               not easily transportable «form» as it is a gas
                                                                                             Accept “«hydrogen combustion
               OR                                                                            contributes to» knocking in engines” OR
               heavy containers required to carry AND compress/regulate «hydrogen»           “modified engine required” for M2.
               OR
               high energy/cost required to compress hydrogen to transportable liquid form
               OR
               atmospheric pollution may be generated during production of hydrogen                                                     2
               OR
               hydrogen fuel cells do not work at very low temperatures
               OR
               highly flammable when compressed/difficult to extinguish fires                Accept “explosive” but not “more
               OR                                                                            dangerous” for M2.

               leaks not easy to detect
               OR
               high cost of production
               OR
               lack of filling stations/availability to consumer «in many countries» 
                                                                            – 28 –                                M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

                                                                                           wrong electrode.
                CH3OH (aq) + H2O (l)           6H (aq) + 6e− + CO2 (g) 

                3

                2

                allows Hions pass through/diffuse/move «from anode to cathode but not    Accept “acts as a salt bridge”.
                                                                                                                                        1
                electrons or small molecules» 

                membrane» to cathode/positive electrode                                                                                2
                 
                H /ions used to reduce oxygen at cathode/positive electrode               Oxygen must be mentioned for M2.

18. a    i                                                                     Accept “B” alone for incoming radiation
                          Type of radiation                           Region   from sun.
                Incoming radiation from sun                     A «and B»                                                           1
                Re-radiated from Earth's surface                B              All three correct answers necessary for
                                                                               mark.
                Absorbed by CO2 in the atmosphere               B

18.   a   ii   both between 400–700 «nm»                                      Accept any wavelength within the 400-
                                                                               700 nm visible region range for M1 and
               -carotene at higher wavelength than retinal                                                                        2
                                                                               any higher wavelength for -carotene
                                                                               within the same region for M2.
18.   b   i    CO2 (aq) + H2O (l)  H2CO3 (aq)                                State symbols AND equilibrium sign
                                                                               required for mark in (b) (i) only.
                                                                               Accept “CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H+ (aq) 
                                                                               HCO3- (aq)”                                          1
                                                                               OR
                                                                               “CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  2H+ (aq)  CO32- (aq)”.

(Question 18b continued)

   Question                                          Answers                                                            Notes                    Total
 18. b    ii     CO2 (aq) + H2O (l)  2H (aq) + CO3 (aq)                                            Equilibrium sign needed in (b) (ii) but
                                                                                                       penalize missing equilibrium sign once
                 OR                                                                                    only in (b) (i) and (ii).

                 CO2 (aq) + H2O (l)  H (aq) + HCO3 (aq)
                                                                                                       Do not accept “CO2 (aq) + H2O (l) 
                 OR
                                                                                                       H2CO3 (aq)” unless equation was not
                 H2CO3 (aq) + H2O (l)  H3O (aq) + HCO3 (aq)                                         given in b (i).
                 OR
                 H2CO3 (aq)  H (aq) + HCO3 (aq)
                                                                                                                                                  2
                 OR
                 H2CO3 (aq) + 2H2O (l)  2H3O (aq) + CO32 (aq)

                 OR
                 H2CO3 (aq)  2H (aq) + CO32 (aq) 


                 equilibrium shifts to the right causing increase in [H3O]/[H] «thereby decreasing
                 pH» 

             DSSC             dye absorbs a photon     redox reaction involving I–/iodide

19. b        Any of:                                                                            Accept “lower mass/lighter «so greater
             cheaper                                                                            flexibility to integrate into windows
                                                                                                etc.»” OR “greater power-conversion
             OR                                                                                 efficiency «with latest DSSC models»”.
             ease of fabrication
             OR
             use light of lower energy/lower frequency/longer wavelength
             OR
             plentiful and renewable resources «to construct DSSC cells»
             OR
             operate at lower «internal» temperatures/better at radiating heat away «since
                                                                                                                                          1
             constructed with thin front layer of conductive plastic compared to glass box in
             photovoltaic cell»
             OR
             use of nanoparticles provides large surface area exposure to sunlight/sun/light
             OR
             can absorb better under cloudy conditions
             OR
             better conductivity
             OR
             more flexible 

20.   a    iii   Any two of:                                                               Accept “carboxylic acid” for “carboxyl”,
                 2500–3000 «cm–1» / «absorbance» due to O–H in carboxyl                   “acetate/ester” for “ethanoate”.

                 1700–1750 «cm–1» / «absorbance» due to CO in carboxyl/ethanoate         within indicated range.                    2 max

                 melting point                                                            “spectrometry” where mentioned but
                                                                                           not “spectrum”.
                 mass spectrometry/MS 

                 high-performance liquid chromatography/HPLC                              spectroscopy/UV/UV-Vis”.

                 NMR/nuclear magnetic resonance                                           Do not accept “gas
                 X-ray crystallography                                                    chromatography/GC”.

21. a          Any two of:                                                                  Accept “alcohol/hydroxy” for “hydroxyl”
               diamorphine has ester/ethanoate/acetate «groups» AND morphine has hydroxyl   but not “hydroxide”.
               «groups» 
                                                                                                                                       2 max
               diamorphine/ester/ethanoate/acetate groups less polar                       Accept “diamorphine non-polar”.
               diamorphine more soluble in lipids                                          Accept converse statements.
21.   b        morphine has a smaller therapeutic window                                   Accept converse statements.


                                                                                            Accept “codeine has lower activity” OR
                                                                                            “codeine has lower risk of overdose”
                                                                                            OR “codeine is less potent”.
                                                                                                                                         1

                                                                                            Do not accept “lower abuse potential
                                                                                            for codeine” OR “codeine less addictive”
                                                                                            OR “codeine has a lower
                                                                                            bioavailability”.

             OR

             OR
             chiral auxiliary creates stereochemical condition «necessary to follow a certain
             pathway»

             OR
             stereochemical induction
             OR
             existing chiral centre affects configuration of new chiral centres 


             «after new chiral centre created» chiral auxiliary removed «to obtain desired
             product» 
